nodes.title: fix: resolved border collapse issue #1626 when border variants are mixed in button group
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1626
📝 Description
The radius property does not work on the 'buttonGroup' component. The variant="bordered" option does not display the correct borders.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
The radius is always the same as md.
The border-left is covered by  margin-left ml-[calc(theme(borderWidth.medium)*-1)].
  <ButtonGroup color="success" radius="lg" variant="flat">
    <Button>One</Button>
    <Button>Two</Button>
    <Button variant="bordered">Three</Button>
    <Button>Four</Button>
    <Button>Five</Button>
    <Button>Six</Button>
  </ButtonGroup>
🚀 New behavior
The radius now works, and the border is displayed correctly in the buttonGroup.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information
Please kindly let me know if any suggestions.

commit.message: fix(button): not show the correct borders
refactor: button-group variant handling in button-group.stories.tsx

Revert "fix(button-group): radius not work"

This reverts commit 6233690d8acd96664c48d4f721c481bcb4095be4.
fix: remove isIsolate because using a negative value for the margin will always cover the neighbor
fix(changeset): remove radius part for another PR
test: add multiple variant buttons on storybook
feat: use adjacent selector to remove doubles border
refactor: use collapseAdjacentVariantBorders to wrap an adjacent selector

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%228352f8f2d38bc58ccddf8d0b96d8f5d0f5c6844c%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmfPTJmc5qo6GkRCEzNYc9bMRpGLnjHHyMJcBifNAVQ55n%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1637%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

![image](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/25524993/a9c6d2fc-52ca-481b-9492-47a225e807f2)

https://nextui-storybook-v2-git-fork-chongruei-fix162-f030f9-nextui-org.vercel.app/?path=/story/components-buttongroup--default

> I am a new frontend developer who wants to improve programming skills through open source. I would like to know how you solved this problem. Could you please tell me the reasons and solutions for this problem?

It wasn't solved.

Hi @jguddas 

Sorry, I've missed radius as the default prop from theme.ts.  Could you check this again?

Can you add something like this as a story?

```
  <ButtonGroup color="success" radius="lg" variant="flat">
    <Button>One</Button>
    <Button>Two</Button>
    <Button variant="bordered">Three</Button>
    <Button>Four</Button>
    <Button>Five</Button>
    <Button>Six</Button>
  </ButtonGroup>
```

> Hi @jguddas
> 
> Sorry, I've missed radius as the default prop from theme.ts. Could you check this again?

Can you tell me why you added an isIsolate attribute instead of directly taking the following approach?

![image](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/102582646/b81a437e-5e22-4d86-a340-873121b421e6)

> > Hi @jguddas
> > Sorry, I've missed radius as the default prop from theme.ts. Could you check this again?
> 
> Can you tell me why you added an isIsolate attribute instead of directly taking the following approach?
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102582646/268461486-b81a437e-5e22-4d86-a340-873121b421e6.png)

This can also solve this problem.

> > > Hi @jguddas
> > > Sorry, I've missed radius as the default prop from theme.ts. Could you check this again?
> > 
> > 
> > Can you tell me why you added an isIsolate attribute instead of directly taking the following approach?
> > ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102582646/268461486-b81a437e-5e22-4d86-a340-873121b421e6.png)
> 
> This can also solve this problem.

Hi, @Digoler, it would be like without isIsolate

![Screenshot 2023-09-17 at 1 26 04 AM](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/19293733/3f82f4cc-d7e5-4c83-8378-4e5bdf3c7fed)

After defining the isIsolate

![Screenshot 2023-09-17 at 1 29 51 AM](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/19293733/d945a92b-0de8-4df7-b649-82facb2f95b7)

> > > ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102582646/268461486-b81a437e-5e22-4d86-a340-873121b421e6.png)
> > 
> > 
> > This can also solve this problem.
> 
> Hi, @Digoler, it would be like without isIsolate
> 
> ![Screenshot 2023-09-17 at 1 26 04 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19293733/268462028-3f82f4cc-d7e5-4c83-8378-4e5bdf3c7fed.png)
> 
> After defining the isIsolate
> 
> ![Screenshot 2023-09-17 at 1 29 51 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19293733/268462184-d945a92b-0de8-4df7-b649-82facb2f95b7.png)

Thank you, I have learned a lot.

Another edge case for you

```tsx
  <ButtonGroup color="success" radius="lg" variant="flat">
    <Button>One</Button>
    <Button>Two</Button>
    <Button variant="bordered">Three</Button>
    <Button variant="bordered">Four</Button>
    <Button variant="bordered">Five</Button>
    <Button>Six</Button>
  </ButtonGroup>
```

And another one where `ButtonGroup.variant` is `bordered`

```tsx
 <ButtonGroup color="success" radius="lg" variant="bordered">
    <Button>One</Button>
    <Button>Two</Button>
    <Button variant="bordered">Three</Button>
    <Button>Four</Button>
    <Button>Five</Button>
    <Button>Six</Button>
  </ButtonGroup>
```

> And another one where `ButtonGroup.variant` is `bordered`
> 
> ```tsx
>  <ButtonGroup color="success" radius="lg" variant="bordered">
>     <Button>One</Button>
>     <Button>Two</Button>
>     <Button variant="bordered">Three</Button>
>     <Button>Four</Button>
>     <Button>Five</Button>
>     <Button>Six</Button>
>   </ButtonGroup>
> ```

Thank you! I will check for this.

In case you are closing the PR, so it does not get accidentally merged:
https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/changing-the-stage-of-a-pull-request#converting-a-pull-request-to-a-draft

Hi! @jguddas I finally removed the negative value for the margin because it always covered the neighbor. Like this ![Screenshot 2023-09-18 at 1 12 34 AM](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/19293733/986bd834-e91d-4679-b07d-2fd02a63e833) It appears that removing the negative value for the margin has led to a situation where the border size doubles when the colors are the same. What are your thoughts on this issue?

> It appears that removing the negative value for the margin has led to a situation where the border size doubles when the colors are the same. What are your thoughts on this issue? Yeah, not a great look. **My proposal:** keep the `isIsolated` but only have it be true when `groupContext.variant !== props.variant`. The edge cases have to be handled by the user, I don't see another way.

**Another idea:**

We could use `peer` and a `data-variant` attribute.

https://play.tailwindcss.com/Dl8H3CEOfv

Edit: `peer` uses `~`, we would need something like peer that uses `+` instead.

We would have to copy this into the next plugin:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/42e75ba4b860ef75656cff3119aa56e70714d34c/src/corePlugins.js#L151-L202

Than something like this would work:
https://play.tailwindcss.com/mtNmipDgp4

Hi @jguddas 

Thank you for your suggestion, which has provided me with a lot of inspiration. I have finally used an adjacent selector to check if the color and variant are the same. If they are the same, I will add a margin-left effect. 

This approach will cover all edge cases.
Great work btw. This covers all the edge cases; I didn't think this would be achievable.
Can you describe the change more precisely, "now works" does not tell me anything?

nodes.body:
I would prefer using `data-color` and `data-variant` over `.nextui-adjacent-…`
```suggestion
        [
          "[[data-variant=bordered][data-color=default]_+_&]:ml-[calc(theme(borderWidth.2)*-1)]",
          "[[data-variant=ghost][data-color=default]_+_&]:ml-[calc(theme(borderWidth.2)*-1)]"
        ],
```

You could add a file with all these selectors in `../utils` to make it reusable.
```suggestion
        utils.collapseAdjacentVariantBorders.default,
```
When thinking about it using a class name also isn't that bad, it's pretty much just like using `peer`.

Something like this would also work.
```suggestion
        "[&+.border-medium.border-default]:ml-[calc(theme(borderWidth.medium)*-1)]",
```

The good part about this is we can add support for having different border widths other than `medium`.

Thank you @jguddas 

I have finally placed ```collapseAdjacentVariantBorders``` in the ```utils``` folder to make it reusable. This change also enables support for other border widths in the future.

nodes.bodyText: Huge thanks @chongruei @jguddas  ❤️

nodes.title: refactor: optimize the time of ripple destroy
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
optimize ripple destroy time, destroy it when the animation ends, not after 1 second
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Destroy ripple after 1 second
🚀 New behavior
Destroy ripple when the animation ends
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

📝 Additional Information
I remove the setTimeout method, and replaced  with the onTransitionEnd event.

commit.message: refactor: optimize the time of ripple destroy

@jrgarciadev @jguddas Regarding ripples, I found a potential risk. Using `Date.now()` as the id may be repeated in some special cases, such as the user triggering two click events at the same time in a short period of time, so I recommend changing the id to unique value.

nodes.title: Fix/1632
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1632
📝 Description
The modal closes immediately if it is opened from the Dropdown component.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
The modal automatically closes when triggered by onMenuAction in use-dropdown.ts.
🚀 New behavior
The modal will not close when menuAction is performed.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information
Please kindly let me know if any suggestions.

commit.message: fix(dropdown): modal close by dropdown menuaction

nodes.title: fix(accordion): accordion is no longer preventing spacebar
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1405
Closes #1608
📝 Description
Accordion prevents Spacebar key event
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Accordion prevents Spacebar key event
🚀 New behavior
Custom hook use-aria-accordion added to remove needless events handlers
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

  
    
    

    CleanShot.2023-09-15.at.15.59.55.mp4

commit.message: fix(accordion): accordion is no longer preventing spacebar

+# @nextui-org/use-aria-accordion
+
+A Quick description of the component
+
+> This is an internal utility, not intended for public usage.
+
+## Installation
+
+```sh
+yarn add @nextui-org/use-aria-accordion
+# or
+npm i @nextui-org/use-aria-accordion
+```
+
+## Contribution
+
+Yes please! See the
+[contributing guidelines](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
+for details.
+
+## Licence
+
+This project is licensed under the terms of the
+[MIT license](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/master/LICENSE).

nodes.title: Fix/1597
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1597
📝 Description
Modal(scrollBehavior) - Type 'string' is not assignable to type '"inside" | "normal" | "outside" | undefined'.ts(2322)
const [scrollBehavior, setScrollBehavior] = React.useState("inside");
  
<Modal
  isOpen={isOpen}
  onOpenChange={onOpenChange}
  scrollBehavior={scrollBehavior} // <- unassignable type
>
  {children}
</Modal>
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
compile error
🚀 New behavior
add ts support
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No
📝 Additional Information

nodes.title: fix: avoid `src` in import path
nodes.bodyText:
Related to #1595
📝 Description
To prevent src in import path in '*.d.ts', the types should be exported in index.ts.
Specifically, the following error is fixed:
node_modules/@nextui-org/button/dist/use-button.d.ts:1:52 - error TS2307: Cannot find module '@nextui-org/ripple/src/use-ripple' or its corresponding type declarations.

1 import * as _nextui_org_ripple_src_use_ripple from '@nextui-org/ripple/src/use-ripple';
                                                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node_modules/@nextui-org/card/dist/use-card.d.ts:1:52 - error TS2307: Cannot find module '@nextui-org/ripple/src/use-ripple' or its corresponding type declarations.

1 import * as _nextui_org_ripple_src_use_ripple from '@nextui-org/ripple/src/use-ripple';
                                                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node_modules/@nextui-org/select/dist/hidden-select.d.ts:4:52 - error TS2307: Cannot find module '@nextui-org/use-aria-multiselect/src/use-multiselect-state' or its corresponding type declarations.

4 import { MultiSelectState, MultiSelectProps } from '@nextui-org/use-aria-multiselect/src/use-multiselect-state';
                                                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node_modules/@nextui-org/select/dist/use-select.d.ts:2:77 - error TS2307: Cannot find module '@nextui-org/use-aria-multiselect/src/use-multiselect-state' or its corresponding type declarations.

2 import * as _nextui_org_use_aria_multiselect_src_use_multiselect_state from '@nextui-org/use-aria-multiselect/src/use-multiselect-state';

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Running tsc gives the above errors.
🚀 New behavior
Errors are fixed. No impact on runtime.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

nodes.title: fix(links): corrected typo in accordion link
nodes.bodyText:
Closes # 
📝 Description
This PR corrects a typo error in one of the links on the website. The link previously read "accordiom-item-classnames" and has been updated to "accordion-item-classnames" to ensure users can access the intended content without disruptions.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
The current link on the website, "accordiom-item-classnames", leads to a non-existent or unintended page due to the typo.
🚀 New behavior
With this PR, the link "accordion-item-classnames" will correctly direct users to the intended page.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No.

📝 Additional Information
Ensuring accurate links enhances the user experience and ensures seamless navigation throughout the website.

nodes.title: fix: added input error message and description screen reader support
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
useTextField uses useField which adds aria-describedby only when the errorMessage or `description is provided.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
aria-describedby does not include the error message or description and thus does not get read out by screen readers.
🚀 New behavior
It gets read out by screen readers.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No.
📝 Additional Information
https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/blob/main/packages/%40react-types/shared/src/inputs.d.ts#L77

commit.message: fix: added input error message and description screen reader support

+---
+"@nextui-org/pagination": patch
+---
+
+fix: fixed pagination scale animation
+
+For animations of the pagination cursor to be enabled data-moving needs to be set to true.
+We are now setting the data-moving to false 300ms after setting the cursor scale to 1.

nodes.title: Fix/1561
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1561
📝 Description
Select component has an extra white space which the Input does not have. It make using them in the same layout more difficult as necessary.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Select has a bottom space when including helper components
🚀 New behavior
Bottom space removed
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

----
-"@nextui-org/pagination": patch
----
-
-fix: fixed pagination scale animation
-
-For animations of the pagination cursor to be enabled data-moving needs to be set to true.
-We are now setting the data-moving to false 300ms after setting the cursor scale to 1.

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+---
+"@nextui-org/pagination": patch
+"@nextui-org/theme": patch
+---
+
+fix: resolved cursor issues in pagination
+
+- The cursor does not animate anymore on initial render and non page change prop changes.
+- The cursor hover state now looks good with disableAnimation set.
+- The animated cursor is now transparent to the cursor (pointer-events: none).

@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+---
+"@nextui-org/navbar": patch
+---
+
+Navbar menu scroll fixed

@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+---
+"@nextui-org/system-rsc": patch
+"@nextui-org/theme": patch
+---
+
+Tailwind variants upgraded to the latest version v0.1.14

@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+---
+"@nextui-org/pagination": patch
+---
+
+fix: fixed pagination scale animation
+
+For animations of the pagination cursor to be enabled data-moving needs to be set to true.
+We are now setting the data-moving to false 300ms after setting the cursor scale to 1.

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+---
+"@nextui-org/pagination": patch
+---
+
+fix: fixed pagination scale animation
+
+For animations of the pagination cursor to be enabled data-moving needs to be set to true.
+We are now setting the data-moving to false 300ms after setting the cursor scale to 1.

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -1,10 +0,0 @@
----
-"@nextui-org/pagination": patch
-"@nextui-org/theme": patch
----
-
-fix: resolved cursor issues in pagination
-
-- The cursor does not animate anymore on initial render and non page change prop changes.
-- The cursor hover state now looks good with disableAnimation set.
-- The animated cursor is now transparent to the cursor (pointer-events: none).

@@ -1,5 +0,0 @@
----
-"@nextui-org/navbar": patch
----
-
-Navbar menu scroll fixed

-fix: fixed pagination scale animation

-For animations of the pagination cursor to be enabled data-moving needs to be set to true.
-We are now setting the data-moving to false 300ms after setting the cursor scale to 1.

nodes.title: Fix/1531
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1531
📝 Description
Tab passes the title to the HTML element which lead to render [Object object] values
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Tab passes the title to the HTML element
🚀 New behavior
New prop added to Tab items titleValue which allows users pass the nativetitle prop to the HTML element, original title was removed from the list of valid properties.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): NO

📝 Additional Information

commit.message: fix(tabs): title prop was being passed to html element

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+---
+"@nextui-org/tabs": patch
+---
+
+Fix #1531 title props filtered, titleValue prop added to pass the title to the HTML element.

@@ -13,7 +13,7 @@ Tabs organize content into multiple sections and allow users to navigate between
 
 ---
 
-<CarbonAd/>
+<CarbonAd />
 
 ## Import
 
@@ -157,10 +157,11 @@ You can customize the `Tabs` component by passing custom Tailwind CSS classes to
 
 ### Tab Props
 
-| Attribute  | Type        | Description             | Default |
-| ---------- | ----------- | ----------------------- | ------- |
-| children\* | `ReactNode` | The content of the tab. | -       |
-| title      | `ReactNode` | The title of the tab.   | -       |
+| Attribute  | Type        | Description                                                                                | Default |
+| ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------- |
+| children\* | `ReactNode` | The content of the tab.                                                                    | -       |
+| title      | `ReactNode` | The title of the tab.                                                                      | -       |
+| titleValue | `string`    | A string representation of the item's contents. Use this when the `title` is not readable. | -       |
 
 #### Motion Props

@@ -89,12 +89,16 @@ const WithIconsTemplate = (args: TabsProps) => (
       tab: "text-lg",
     }}
   >
-    <Tab key="align-left" title={<AlignLeftBoldIcon />} />
-    <Tab key="align-vertically" title={<AlignVerticallyBoldIcon />} />
-    <Tab key="align-right" title={<AlignRightBoldIcon />} />
-    <Tab key="align-top" title={<AlignTopBoldIcon />} />
-    <Tab key="align-horizontally" title={<AlignHorizontallyBoldIcon />} />
-    <Tab key="align-bottom" title={<AlignBottomBoldIcon />} />
+    <Tab key="align-left" title={<AlignLeftBoldIcon />} titleValue="Align left" />
+    <Tab key="align-vertically" title={<AlignVerticallyBoldIcon />} titleValue="Align vertically" />
+    <Tab key="align-right" title={<AlignRightBoldIcon />} titleValue="Align right" />
+    <Tab key="align-top" title={<AlignTopBoldIcon />} titleValue="Align top" />
+    <Tab
+      key="align-horizontally"
+      title={<AlignHorizontallyBoldIcon />}
+      titleValue="Align horizontally"
+    />
+    <Tab key="align-bottom" title={<AlignBottomBoldIcon />} titleValue="Align bottom" />
   </Tabs>
 );

+---
+"@nextui-org/select": patch
+"@nextui-org/input": patch
+"@nextui-org/theme": patch
+---
+
+Fix #1492 \n
+
+- Select adn Input spaces fixed on helper wrapper
+- New select wrapper added `mainWrapper` which contains the helperWrapper and the trigger slots
+- Outside input with start content fixed

@@ -254,6 +254,7 @@ the popover and listbox components.
 
 - **base**: The main wrapper of the select. This wraps the rest of the slots.
 - **label**: The label of the select.
+- **mainWrapper**: Wraps the `helperWrapper` and the `trigger` slots.
 - **trigger**: The trigger of the select. This wraps the label the inner wrapper and the selector icon.
 - **innerWrapper**: The wrapper of the select content. This wraps the start/end content and the select value.
 - **selectorIcon**: The selector icon of the select. This is the icon that rotates when the select is open (`data-open`).
@@ -369,7 +370,7 @@ the popover and listbox components.
 | popoverProps                 | [PopoverProps](/docs/components/popover#api)                                                                                                                                                   | Props to be passed to the popover component.                                                            | -                  |

 | scrollShadowProps            | [ScrollShadowProps](/docs/components/scroll-shadow#api)                                                                                                                                        | Props to be passed to the scroll shadow component.                                                      | -                  |

nodes.title: Fix/1298
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1298
📝 Description
Navbar Menu lacks focus trapping
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Navbar Menu lacks focus trapping
🚀 New behavior
Dismissable buttons added to trap navbar menu focus
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

nodes.title: fix: title prop of a tab should be a string
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1531
📝 [Description](fix: title prop of a tab should be a string)

Add a brief description

⛳️ It will cause the incorrect title [object Object] to be displayed when hovering over it.

Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying

🚀 New behavior

Only when title is a string can it be passed to HTML elements.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):No

commit.message: fix: title prop of a tab should be a string

nodes.title: Solved error in Listbox Component
nodes.bodyText:
Closes # 
📝 Description

The ListboxWrapper was not being identified and because of that the component was not loading on the webpage.

⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

when running the code the webpage goes blank.

🚀 New behavior

It solves the issue by exporting the ListboxWrapper so that it can be identified.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):

📝 Additional Information
